Professional Installation Process

Expert installation and setup for optimal performance

1

System Compatibility Check

Assess your current HVAC system and wiring to ensure proper thermostat compatibility and operation.

2

Safe Removal & Wiring

Carefully remove old thermostat, update wiring if needed, and prepare for new thermostat installation.

3

Professional Installation

Mount and connect new thermostat following manufacturer specifications and safety protocols.

4

System Configuration

Configure thermostat settings, test all functions, and ensure proper communication with HVAC system.

5

Setup & Training

Complete WiFi setup, app installation, schedule programming, and provide comprehensive operation training.

Frequently Asked Questions

Can I install a smart thermostat myself?

While some thermostats are marketed as DIY-friendly, professional installation ensures proper wiring, configuration, and prevents damage to your HVAC system. We also handle WiFi setup and full configuration.

Will a smart thermostat work with my old HVAC system?

Most modern thermostats are compatible with older systems, but compatibility depends on your specific wiring and equipment. We'll assess your system and recommend the best options during our consultation.

How much money can I save with a smart thermostat?

EPA studies show smart thermostats can save 10-23% on heating and cooling costs. For an average North Texas home, this translates to $130-$180 in annual savings.

Do you provide warranty on thermostat installation?

Yes, we provide a 1-year warranty on installation labor, and all thermostats come with manufacturer warranties ranging from 1-5 years depending on the model.
